snippet: Despite promises to reform the criminal justice system, President Obama’s use of the pardon power remains low.
abstract: Editorial observes the use of executive clemency has been declining for decades; criticizes Pres Obama for his limited use of pardon power, despite his promises to reform the criminal justice system; contends any meaningful reform of the criminal justice system must include the clemency process, by which the most punitive tendencies of the system are tempered.
lead_paragraph: Despite promises to reform the criminal justice system, President Obama’s use of the pardon power remains low.

headline.print_headline: What Happened to Clemency?: Despite justice-reform promise, pardon rate remains low
